channel.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
channel.description:
Hello. Today I wrote up another RuneScape loader, however this time it's not so basic as my last one. This loader supports using simply the Rs2Applet class loader, a custom class loader, decrypting (or not) of the inner.pack.gz file, and etc. This could be easily formed into a basic bot (if you had the knowledge of making a bot).
Usage:
[code] #!/bin/bash java -cp bin:lib/*.jar: Application <decrypt>[/code]
If you want the loader to be less detectable set the decrypt value to false, only set it to true if you plan on editing the client, or making a bot.
Download:
[url=http://hijackrs.com/resources/Tools/HijackRS.com%20Loader%20(Beta).zip]http://hijackrs.com/resources/Tools/HijackRS.com%20Loader%20(Beta).zip[/url]
Have fun messing with it. This loader is designed a lot differently from other loaders I think you will find :P

item.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
item.dc:creator: @CheatoX CheatoX
item.description:
@CheatoX wrote:

As long as the cluster fluttering is present in the loaded client and not removed by any kind of deobfuscation technique, it’s not a good idea to go the reflection way. The concept of reflection still works but for a bot it wouldn’t be efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“n3ss3s, post:10, topic:425476”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=528141.msg3851702#msg3851702 date=1324075155]
I cant be arsed to look at the source, but if all this does is load the applet don’t you still run into the same issues as before where we couldn’t use reflection because of the preventative measures jagex put in? That’s what I’m asking
[/quote]

Jagex broke updaters, not the concept of reflection/injection itself…[/quote]And unless I completely misunderstand the concept, in order to make an effective bot you’d need to have an updater to use those effectively? That’s why I said:

Davidi2:

(effectively, with each update)

Read full topic

item.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s
item.description:
@n3ss3s wrote:

Davidi2:

I cant be arsed to look at the source, but if all this does is load the applet don’t you still run into the same issues as before where we couldn’t use reflection because of the preventative measures jagex put in? That’s what I’m asking

Jagex broke updaters, not the concept of reflection/injection itself…

Read full topic

item.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`
item.description:
@_Discardedx21 wrote:

Davidi2:

Then I must have missed something before, because people then were saying that in the current state of the client it would be nigh on impossible to get a reflection bot to work (effectively, with each update). So does yours somehow not have that issue, or did they change it? Or am I missing something here

dont know. i’ve never had that issue

Read full topic

item.title: HijackingRS RuneScape Loader
item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`
item.description:
@_Discardedx21 wrote:

Davidi2:

Just like we said when Jacmob was talking about being able to ‘load rs’ but not inject hooks, loading the client and creating a bot are much more different than they used to be

what are you on about? i can inject hooks on my own bot, however i am no longer working on an injection bot. You can also use reflection with this loader to make a reflection bot, or use it for any other purposes. the loader is very flexible. could you clear up what you mean? i’m not quite sure 100% what point you were trying to make.

Read full topic
